The claim made by Nigeria: s Guardian newspaper was that there had not been more than 15 vice-chancellors in the country's higher education history.
Africa Check: an independent fact-checking organization, examined available data, media reports, and other sources to compile a list of more than 20 past and present vice-chancellors.
The journalist who wrote the article for: s Guardian newspaper used online research and input from academics to arrive at the number "not up to 15" female vice-chancellors.
Oluwayemisi Obilade: a professor of adult education and women's studies, suggested checking the National Universities Commission (NUC) as a potential source of data, but cautioned that the number of female vice-chancellors would be significantly smaller compared to male vice-chancellors.
